snippet: After a robust performance earlier this year, the nation reported a 3.5 percent drop in its economy in the third quarter.
abstract: Japan reports its economy shrank at pace of 0.9 percent in three months through September, as sluggish imports compounded slowing demand and edged nation’s economy toward recession; data is reversal from Japan’s robust performance earlier in year, when it outperformed most of its peers in the Group of 7 industrialized nations.
lead_paragraph: After a robust performance earlier this year, the nation reported a 3.5 percent drop in its economy in the third quarter.

headline.seo: Japanese Economy Contracts, Suggesting Return to Recession
headline.main: In Reversal of Earlier Quarters, Data Suggest Japan Is Near Recession
headline.print_headline: In Reversal of Earlier Quarters, Data Suggest Japan Is Near Recession
